page.title: 09Pontllanfraith Health Centre
page.content: The Health Centre is near the Civic Centre. It was built to serve the people of Pontllanfraith and Blackwood. It is a modern building made of yellow brick with a sloping roof. There are seven doctors, all men. They are McSharry, Noble, Hussain, Sahni, Sabah and H.M.Hussain. The centre has four waiting rooms, for the doctors, dentists, pharmacy and optician. There are seven clinics and a nurse. The results of a survey carried out by the school show that the centre's busiest day is Thursday. Six doctors have a surgery on this day and four of the clinics are open. Friday is also a busy day because of the baby clinic. Wednesday is the quietest day as there is only one doctor on duty.
